meanings.def: the brother of your mother or father; the husband of your aunt or uncle
examples: I'm going to visit my uncle.
a maternal/paternal uncle (= related through the mother’s/father's side of the family)
I've just become an uncle (= because my brother/sister has had a baby).
uncle to somebody Joey was like an uncle to us.
He was the youngest son of Edward III and uncle to Richard II.
The celebrant of the Mass was Rev. Martin Doyle, uncle of the bride.
He looks so much like his late uncle.
The boss smiled at us all like a benevolent uncle.
the fortune left to her by her dead uncle

meanings.def: used by children, with a first name, to address a man who is a close friend of their parents
used as a polite way of addressing or referring to an older man
examples: The uncle who lives opposite my parents is always so warm and friendly.

meanings.def: used to say how easy and quick it is to do a particular task
examples: Press here and Bob's your uncle! It's disappeared.

idioms.def: used to say how easy and quick it is to do a particular task
examples: Press here and Bob's your uncle! It's disappeared.
